captions.text:
Ok why? WHY? WHY? WHY? WHY Argentina? Dustin,
I don't understand WHY ARGENTINA? Why does

an American like my country so much? I don't
get it! The most common question I get asked

is this, Why Argentina?, Dustin I don't get
it please explain this to me, because I need

to know now! First and foremost, my name is
Dustin and I am from The United States AKA

"A Yankee" and I love the culture in Argentina.
I love it! It has everything you could ask

for. You guys, The Argentines, if you are
listening you guys have it all! A beautiful

country! Let's start by talking about the
race in Argentina. It's a gorgeous race! Some

of the first early settlers were 50% Italian,
25% Spanish, and 25% from all over Europe

and with this mix of races and mix or personalities
it creates some beautiful people. The makeup

of your skin is a mixture of different tones..it's
an exotic race. An exotic race! Seriously!

With different colored looking eyes. It's
incredible! All of the Argentines or the majority

of the Argentines are some of the most beautiful
people in the world. I love Argentine women.

I love them! If the women from Argentina are
listening to me..I love you! I love all of

you! And about that, the Argentine accent,
obviously there are various accents in Argentina,

but I am most accustomed to the Porteño accent
as many of you know I made a video about "Things

That Porteños Say". The Porteño accent is
extremely unique and we all know that. Any

Spanish speaker can go to any part of the
world and identify an Argentine in a second

because their accent is so different. You
guys sing when you speak. You are basically

singing! You guys are pretty much a bunch
of Italians who all speak in Spanish with

your tonal ups and downs and it's just great!
I have heard numerous Spanish accents in the

world, but the Argentine accent stood out
to me the most. Hearing someone (with the

Argentine accent) say "Hey how are you? All
good?" It has so much character and personality

and that is what I love the most. Argentina
is a country that has it all. It has mountains,

deserts, waterfalls, lakes, an incredible
city! Buenos Aires is amazing! What I like

to say is that Buenos Aires is a lost European
city that found it's way into South America

and there it stayed. For example, any person
can travel to Buenos Aires and say to themselves

"Is this really South America? It can't be.
Look at the buildings they are immaculate."

I love that city. I love it! It has amazing
vibes. It's a city that never sleep. For example,

there are parties and things happening every
minute, day, week, year etc. It's almost impossible

for a person to be bored in Buenos Aires.
It's impossible! Also, the way that the Argentines

speak with their gestures. They speak like
this with their hands. It's as if they have

passion when they speak. The Argentines have
passion! Just mentioning this gives me goose

bumps. Seriously! I doubt you can tell, but...I
love it! Let's talk about the Argentine lifestyle.

It's all about living for the moment. In the
US, life is so quick. You have to work work

work 20 hours a day. You have to make money
and it's just such a fast life in the US.

In Argentina, everyone takes their time. If
someone says "Let's go get a coffee." You

go and you enjoy it to it's fullest. You might
be there for an hour to an hour and a half.

You take the time to enjoy good conversation
and truly build a relationship. In the US

it's all business and the amount of relationship
building doesn't even compare to how it is

in Argentina. The affection that you guys
have when you simply say hello for the first

time. "Hi, how are you (kiss) (hug) as if
you are truly interested in seeing them. In

the US it's not like that. Greeting someone
is very cold when you compare the two. Don't

get me wrong, I'm not saying that I don't
like my own country. I love the US and it

will always be my first home, but what I am
getting at is that in Argentina it has something

different about it and that's what grabs my
attention the most. When I am in Argentina

I generally feel happy. I tell myself "WOW!
I am on the other side of the planet, but

in a place that I can without a doubt call
my second home. When I speak to everyone in

the states about Argentina they just don't
get it. After fully explaining the beauties

of Argentina everyone is so excited to go
and visit Argentina. The quality of the meat

that you guys have. "Bife de Chorizo" medium
rare. "Molleja"! "Molleja doesn't really exist

in the US and I would die to eat "molleja"
right now. So I hope this gives you a taste

of why I have this passion for Argentina.
I know that the Argentines are generally very

proud people, but they have every right to
be. You guys have an amazing country and sure

it's too bad that their is corruption, but
one day Argentina will be on top. That's a

fact. I will always be a huge supporter. Take
care, see you guys soon. Salutation and a
big hug for everyone. Chau!

title: ¿Por Qué Argentina? - Explicado Por Un Yanqui
